title.value: Probabilistic Temporal Prediction of Continuous Disease Trajectories and Treatment Effects Using Neural SDEs
title.justification: The title provided in the input is the exact title from the paper.
title.quote: Probabilistic Temporal Prediction of Continuous Disease Trajectories and Treatment Effects Using Neural SDEs

extractions.description: The paper presents a novel probabilistic temporal model for image-based personalized medicine, leveraging Neural Stochastic Differential Equations (NSDE) to model continuous disease progression and treatment effects. This approach predicts both factual and counterfactual progression trajectories using MRI and tabular clinical data. The experiments were performed on a large dataset related to multiple sclerosis (MS).

type.justification: The paper describes experiments and evaluations performed on a large dataset of patient MRI and clinical data, making it an empirical study.
type.quote: Extensive experiments were performed on a large, multi-centre, proprietary dataset of patient 3D MRI and clinical data acquired during several randomized clinical trials for MS treatments.

name.justification: The paper focuses on using MRI and clinical data to assess disease progression and treatment effects.
name.quote: The proposed causal inference model takes as input the patientâ€™s high dimensional images (MRI) and tabular data, and predicts both factual and counterfactual progression trajectories on different treatments in latent space.

name.justification: The proposed model aims at providing personalized disease progression predictions, fitting the field of Precision Medicine.
name.quote: A deep learning (DL) clinical decision support tool that can predict the future continuous disease evolution for individual patients based on (non-invasive) medical scans, and standard clinical and demographic information, would be enormous.

name.justification: The paper extensively discusses modeling strategies to predict causal treatment effects using NSDEs.
name.quote: Causal inference, combined with uncertainty estimates, provides additional trustworthiness in predicted counterfactual trajectories, and permit the identification of high confidence subgroups of highly responsive patients.

name.justification: The paper introduces NSDEs as a novel model to predict continuous temporal disease trajectories and treatment effects.
name.quote: In this work, we present the first stochastic causal temporal framework to model the continuous temporal evolution of disease progression via Neural Stochastic Differential Equations (NSDE).

is_contributed.justification: NSDEs are presented as a novel contribution of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: In this work, we present the first stochastic causal temporal framework to model the continuous temporal evolution of disease progression via Neural Stochastic Differential Equations (NSDE).

is_executed.justification: The model was trained and executed on the described dataset as part of the experiments.
is_executed.quote: Extensive experiments were performed on a large, multi-centre, proprietary dataset of patient 3D MRI and clinical data acquired during several randomized clinical trials for MS treatments.

is_compared.justification: The paper compared NSDEs with other models such as LSTM and Encoder-Decoder.
is_compared.quote: The proposed NSDE framework had an overall MSE of 0.575 (0.012), as compared to 0.674 (0.014) (non-temporal) and 0.662 (0.014) (LSTM) averaged over all treatments.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Despite not having direct reference section details, 'Neural stochastic differential equations (NSDEs)[37] have recently been proposed...' suggest a previous reference exists.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Neural stochastic differential equations (NSDEs)[37] have recently been proposed as an extension of NODE for probabilistic modeling of trajectories in latent space for tabular data.

name.justification: The paper uses a dataset from six randomized clinical trials related to MS patients.
name.quote: The data is pooled from six randomized clinical trials (RCTs)...

referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset references individual trials but not a specific reference paper for its holistic collection.
referenced_paper_title.quote:
The data is pooled from six randomized clinical trials (RCTs) 

Specific references to papers describing the details about the curated dataset cannot be provided at submission without breaking anonymization.
